title: A Midsommer Nights Dreame [A Midsummer Night's Dream] from Mr. William Shakespeares comedies, histories, & tragedies. Published according to the true originall copies.

characters.name: Hippolyta, queen of the Amazons, betrothed to Theseus
Hermia, daughter to Egeus, in love with Lysander
Philostrate, master of the revels to Theseus

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: NOw faire Hippolita, our nuptiall houre

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: Drawes on apace: foure happy daies bring in

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: Another Moon: but oh, me thinkes, how slow

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: This old Moon wanes; She lingers my desires

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: Like to a Step‑dame, or a Dowager,

lines.speaker: Theseus.
lines.text: Long withering out a yong mans reuennew.

lines.speaker: Hip.
lines.text: Foure daies wil quickly steep in nights

lines.speaker: Hip.
lines.text: Foure nights wil quickly dreame away the time:

lines.speaker: Hip.
lines.text: And then the Moone, like to a siluer bow,

lines.speaker: Hip.
lines.text: Now bent in heauen, shal behold the night

lines.speaker: Hip.
lines.text: Of our solemnities.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Go {% italic: Philostrate %},

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Stirre vp the Athenian youth to merriments,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Turne melancholy forth to Funerals:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: The pale companion is not for our pompe,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Hippolita, I woo'd thee with my sword,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: And wonne thy loue, doing thee iniuries:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: But I will wed thee in another key,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: With pompe, with triumph, and with reuelling.

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Happy be {% italic: Theseus %}, our renowned Duke.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Thanks good {% italic: Egeus %}: what's the news with thee?

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Full of vexation, come I, with complaint

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Against my childe, my daughter Hermia.

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: {% italic: Stand forth Dometrius. %}

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: My Noble Lord,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: This man hath my consent to marrie her.

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: {% italic: Stand forth Lysander. %}

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: And my gracious Duke,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: This man hath bewitch'd the bosome of my childe:

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Thou, thou {% italic: Lysander %}, thou hast giuen her rimes,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: And interchang'd loue‑tokens with my childe:

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Thou hast by Moone‑light at her window sung,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: With faining voice, verses of faining loue,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: And stolne the impression of her fantasie,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: With bracelets of thy haire, rings, gawdes, conceits,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Knackes, trifles, Nose‑gaies, sweet meats (messengers

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Of strong preuailment in vnhardned youth)

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: With cunning hast thou filch'd my daughters heart,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Turn'd her obedience (which is due to me)

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: To stubborne harshnesse. And my gracious Duke,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Be it so she will not heere before your Grace,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Consent to marrie with {% italic: Demetrius %},

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: I beg the ancient priuiledge of Athens;

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: As she is mine, I may dispose of her;

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Which shall be either to this Gentleman,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Or to her death, according to our Law,

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: Immediately prouided in that case.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: What say you Hermia? be aduis'd faire Maide,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To you your Father should be as a God;

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: One that compos'd your beauties; yea and one

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To whom you are but as a forme in waxe

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: By him imprinted: and within his power,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To leaue the figure, or disfigure it:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %} is a worthy Gentleman.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: So is {% italic: Lysander %}.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: In himselfe he is.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: But in this kinde, wanting your fathers voyce.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: The other must be held the worthier.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I would my father look'd but with my eyes.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Rather your eies must with his iudgment looke.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I do entreat your Grace to pardon me.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I know not by what power I am made bold,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Nor how it may concerne my modestie

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: In such a presence heere to pleade my thoughts:

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: But I beseech your Grace, that I may know

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: The worst that may befall me in this case,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: If I refuse to wed {% italic: Demetrius %}.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Either to dye the death, or to abiure

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For euer the society of men.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Therefore faire Hermia question your desires,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Know of your youth, examine well your blood,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Whether (if you yeeld not to your fathers choice)

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: You can endure the liuerie of a Nunne,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For aye to be in shady Cloister mew'd,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To liue a barren sister all your life,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Chanting faint hymnes to the cold fruitlesse Moone,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Thrice blessed they that master so their blood,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To vndergo such maiden pilgrimage,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: But earthlier happie is the Rose distil'd,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Then that which withering on the virgin thorne,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Growes, liues, and dies, in single blessednesse.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: So will I grow, so liue, so die my Lord,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Ere I will yeeld my virgin Patent vp

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Vnto his Lordship, whose vnwished yoake,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: My soule consents not to giue soueraignty.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Take time to pause, and by the next new Moon

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: The sealing day betwixt my loue and me,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For euerlasting bond of fellowship:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Vpon that day either prepare to dye,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For disobedience to your fathers will,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Or else to wed {% italic: Demetrius %} as hee would,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Or on {% italic: Dianaes %} Altar to protest

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For aie, austerity, and single life.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Relent sweet {% italic: Hermia %}, and {% italic: Lysander %}, yeelde

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Thy crazed title to my certaine right.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: You haue her fathers loue, {% italic: Demetrius %}:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Let me haue {% italic: Hermiaes %}: do you marry him.

lines.speaker: Egeus.
lines.text: Scornfull {% italic: Lysander %}, true, he hath my Loue;

lines.speaker: Egeus.
lines.text: A nd what is mine, my loue shall render him.

lines.speaker: Egeus.
lines.text: And she is mine, and all my right of her,

lines.speaker: Egeus.
lines.text: I do estate vnto {% italic: Demetrius %}.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I am my Lord, as well deriu'd as he,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: As well possest: my loue is more then his:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: My fortunes euery way as fairely ranck'd

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: (If not with vantage) as {% italic: Demetrius %}:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And (which is more then all these boasts can be)

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I am belou'd of beauteous {% italic: Hermia %}.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Why should not I then prosecute my right?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %}, Ile auouch it to his head,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Made loue to {% italic: Nedars %} daughter, {% italic: Helena %},

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And won her soule: and she (sweet Ladie) dotes,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Deuoutly dotes, dotes in Idolatry,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Vpon this spotted and inconstant man.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: I must confesse, that I haue heard so much,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: And with {% italic: Demetrius %} thought to haue spoke thereof:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: But being ouer‑full of selfe‑affaires,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: My minde did lose it. But {% italic: Demetrius %} come,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: And come {% italic: Egeus %}, you shall go with me,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: I haue some priuate schooling for you both.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: For you faire {% italic: Hermia %}, looke you arme your selfe,

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To fit your fancies to your Fathers will;

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Or else the Law of Athens yeelds you vp

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: (Which by no meanes we may extenuate)

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: To death, or to a vow of single life.

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Come my {% italic: Hippolita %}, what cheare my loue?

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %} and {% italic: Egeus %} go along:

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: I must imploy you in some businesse

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Against our nuptiall, and conferre with you

lines.speaker: The.
lines.text: Of something, neerely that concernes your selues.

lines.speaker: Ege.
lines.text: With dutie and desire we follow you.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: How now my loue? Why is your cheek so pale?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: How chance the Roses there do fade so fast?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Belike for want of raine, which I could well

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Beteeme them, from the tempest of mine eyes.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: For ought that euer I could reade,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Could euer heare by tale or historie,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: The course of true loue neuer did run smooth,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: But either it was different in blood.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: O crosse! too high to be enthral'd to loue.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Or else misgraffed, in respect of yeares.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: O spight! too old to be ingag'd to yong.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Or else it stood vpon the choise of merit.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: O hell! to choose loue by anothers eie.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Or if there were a simpathie in choise,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Warre, death, or sicknesse, did lay siege to it;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Making it momentarie, as a sound:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Swift as a shadow, short as any dreame,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Briefe as the lightning in the collied night,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: That (in a spleene) vnfolds both heauen and earth;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And ere a man hath power to say, behold,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: The iawes of darknesse do deuoure it vp:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: So quicke bright things come to confusion.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: If then true Louers haue beene euer crost,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: It stands as an edict in destinie:

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Then let vs teach our triall patience,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Because it is a customarie crosse,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: As due to loue, as thoughts, and dreames, and sighes,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Wishes and teares; poore Fancies followers.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: A good perswasion; therefore heare me {% italic: Hermia %},

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I haue a Widdow Aunt, a dowager,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Of great reuennew, and she hath no childe,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: From Athens is her house remou'd seuen leagues,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And she respects me, as her onely sonne:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: There gentle {% italic: Hermia %}, may I marrie thee,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And to that place, the sharpe Athenian Law

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Cannot pursue vs. If thou lou'st me, then

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Steale forth thy fathers house to morrow night:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And in the wood, a league without the towne,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: (Where I did meete thee once with {% italic: Helena %},

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: To do obseruance for a morne of May)

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: There will I stay for thee.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: My good {% italic: Lysander %},

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I sweare to thee, by Cupids strongest bow,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: By his best arrow with the golden head,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: By the simplicitie of Venus Doues,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: By that which knitteth soules, and prospers loue,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And by that fire which burn'd the Carthage Queene,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: When the false Troyan vnder saile was seene,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: By all the vowes that euer men haue broke,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: (In number more then euer women spoke)

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: In that same place thou hast appointed me,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: To morrow truly will I meete with thee.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Keepe promise loue: looke here comes {% italic: Helena %}.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: God speede faire {% italic: Helena %}, whither away?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Cal you me faire? that faire againe vnsay,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %} loues you faire: O happie faire!

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Your eyes are loadstarres, and your tongues sweete ayre

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: More tuneable then Larke to shepheards eare,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: When wheate is greene, when hauthorne buds appeare,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Sicknesse is catching: O were fauor so,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Your words I catch, faire {% italic: Hermia %} ere I go,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: My eare should catch your voice, my eye, your eye,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: My tongue should catch your tongues sweete melodie,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Were the world mine, {% italic: Demetrius %} being bated,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: The rest Ile giue to be to you translated.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: O teach me how you looke, and with what art

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: you sway the motion of {% italic: Demetrius %} hart.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I frowne vpon him, yet he loues me still.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: O that your frownes would teach my smiles

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I giue him curses, yet he giues me loue.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: O that my prayers could such affection mooue.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: The more I hate, the more he followes me.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: The more I loue, the more he hateth me.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: His folly Helena is none of mine.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: None but your beauty, wold that fault wer mine

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Take comfort: he no more shall see my face,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: {% italic: Lysander %} and my selfe will flie this place.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Before the time I did {% italic: Lysander %} see,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Seem'd Athens like a Paradise to mee.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: O then, what graces in my Loue do dwell,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: That he hath turn'd a heauen into hell.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Helen %}, to you our mindes we will vnfold,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: To morrow night, when {% italic: Phoebe %} doth behold

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Her siluer visage, in the watry glasse,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Decking with liquid pearle, the bladed grasse

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: (A time that Louers flights doth still conceale)

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Through {% italic: Athens %} gates, haue we deuis'd to steale.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And in the wood, where often you and I,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Vpon faint Primrose beds, were wont to lye,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Emptying our bosomes, of their counsell sweld:

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: There my {% italic: Lysander %}, and my selfe shall meete,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And thence from {% italic: Athens %} turne away our eyes

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: To seeke new friends and strange companions,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Farwell sweet play‑fellow, pray thou for vs,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And good lucke grant thee thy {% italic: Demetrius %}.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Keepe word {% italic: Lysander %} we must starue our sight,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: From louers foode, till morrow deepe midnight.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I will my {% italic: Hermia %}. {% italic: Helena %} adieu,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: As you on him, {% italic: Demetrius %} dotes on you.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: How happy some, ore othersome can be?

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Through {% italic: Athens %} I am thought as faire as she.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: But what of that? {% italic: Demetrius %} thinkes not so:

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: He will not know, what all, but he doth know,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: And as hee erres, doting on {% italic: Hermias %} eyes;

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: So I, admiring of his qualities:

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Things base and vilde, holding no quantity,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Loue can transpose to forme and dignity,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Loue lookes not with the eyes, but with the minde,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: And therefore is wing'd {% italic: Cupid %} painted blinde.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Nor hath loues minde of any iudgement taste:

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Wings and no eyes, figure, vnheedy haste.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: And therefore is Loue said to be a childe,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Because in choise he is often beguil'd,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: As waggish boyes in game themselues forsweare;

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: So the boy Loue is periur'd euery where.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: For ere {% italic: Demetrius %} lookt on {% italic: Hermias %} eyne,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: He hail'd downe oathes that he was onely mine.

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: And when this Haile some heat from {% italic: Hermia %} felt,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: So he dissolu'd, and showres of oathes did melt,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: I will goe tell him of faire {% italic: Hermias %} flight:

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Then to the wood will he, to morrow night

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: Pursue her; and for his intelligence,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: If I haue thankes, it is a deere expence:

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: But heerein meane I to enrich my paine,

lines.speaker: Hele.
lines.text: To haue his sight thither, and backe againe.

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: Is all our company heere?

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: You were best to call them generally, man by

lines.speaker: Qui.
lines.text: Here is the scrowle of euery mans name, which {% italic: Athens %}, to play in our Enter­

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: First, good {% italic: Peter Quince %}, say what the play treats

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: Marry our play is the most lamentable Come­ {% italic: Pyramus %} and {% italic: Thisbie %}.

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: A very good peece of worke I assure you, and a {% italic: Peter Quince %}, call forth your Actors

lines.speaker: Quince.
lines.text: Answere as I call you. {% italic: Nick Bottome %} the

lines.speaker: Bottome.
lines.text: Ready; name what part I am for, and

lines.speaker: Quince.
lines.text: You {% italic: Nicke Bottome %} are set downe for {% italic: Py­ ramus %}.

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: What is {% italic: Pyramus %}, a louer, or a tyrant?

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: A Louer that kills himselfe most gallantly for

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: That will aske some teares in the true perfor­ {% italic: Ercles %} rarely, or a part to teare a Cat in, to make all {% italic: Phibbus %} carre shall shine {% italic: Ercles %} vaine, a tyrants vaine: a louer is more condo­

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: {% italic: Francis Flute %} the Bellowes‑mender.

lines.speaker: Flu.
lines.text: Heere {% italic: Peter Quince %}.

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: You must take {% italic: Thisbie %} on you.

lines.speaker: Flut.
lines.text: What is {% italic: Thisbie %}, a wandring Knight?

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: It is the Lady that {% italic: Pyramus %} must loue.

lines.speaker: Flut.
lines.text: Nay faith, let not mee play a woman, I haue a

lines.speaker: Qui.
lines.text: That's all one, you shall play it in a Maske, and

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: And I may hide my face, let me play {% italic: Thisbie %} too: {% italic: Thisne, Thisne %}, ah {% italic: Pyramus %} my louer deare, thy {% italic: Thisbie %} deare, and Lady

lines.speaker: Quin.
lines.text: No no, you must play {% italic: Pyramus %}, and {% italic: Flute %}, you {% italic: Thisby %}.

lines.speaker: Bot.
lines.text: Well, proceed.

lines.speaker: Qu.
lines.text: {% italic: Robin Starueling %} the Taylor.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: When I did him at this aduantage take,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: An Asses nole I fixed on his head.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Anon his {% italic: Thisbie %} must be answered,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: And forth my Mimmick comes: when they him spie,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: As Wilde‑geese, that the creeping Fowler eye,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Or russed‑pated choughes, many in sort

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: (Rising and cawing at the guns report)

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Seuer themselues, and madly sweepe the skye:

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: So at his sight, away his fellowes flye,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: And at our stampe, here ore and ore one fals;

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: He murther cries, and helpe from {% italic: Athens %} cals.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Their sense thus weake, lost with their fears thus strong,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Made senselesse things begin to do them wrong.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: For briars and thornes at their apparell snatch,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Some sleeues, some hats, from yeelders all things catch,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: I led them on in this distracted feare,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: And left sweete {% italic: Piramus %} translated there:

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: When in that moment (so it came to passe)

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: {% italic: Tytania %} waked, and straightway lou'd an Asse.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: This fals out better then I could deuise:

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: But hast thou yet lacht the {% italic: Athenians %} eyes,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: With the loue iuyce, as I did bid thee doe?

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: I tooke him sleeping (that is finisht to)

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: And the {% italic: Athenian %} woman by his side,

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: That when he wak't, of force she must be eyde.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Stand close, this is the same {% italic: Athenian %}.

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: This is the woman, but not this the man.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: O why rebuke you him that loues you so?

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Lay breath so bitter on your bitter foe.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Now I but chide, but I should vse thee worse.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: For thou (I feare) hast giuen me cause to curse,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: If thou hast slaine {% italic: Lysander %} in his sleepe,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Being ore shooes in bloud, plunge in the deepe, and kill

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: The Sunne was not so true vnto the day,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: As he to me. Would he haue stollen away,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: From sleeping {% italic: Hermia %}? Ile beleeue as soone

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: This whole earth may be bord, and that the Moone

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: May through the Center creepe, and so displease

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Her brothers noonetide, with th' {% italic: Antipodes %}.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: It cannot be but thou hast murdred him,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: So should a mutrherer looke, so dead, so grim.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: So should the murderer looke, and so should I,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Pierst through the heart with your stearne cruelty:

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Yet you the murderer looks as bright as cleare,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: As yonder {% italic: Venus %} in her glimmering spheare.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: What's this to my {% italic: Lysander %}? where is he {% italic: ? %}

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Ah good {% italic: Demetrius %}, wilt thou giue him me?

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: I'de rather giue his carkasse to my hounds.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Out dog, out cur, thou driu'st me past the bounds

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Of maidens patience. Hast thou slaine him then?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Henceforth be neuer numbred among men.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Oh, once tell true, euen for my sake,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Durst thou a lookt vpon him, being awake?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And hast thou kill'd him sleeping? O braue tutch:

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Could not a worme, an Adder do so much?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: An Adder did it: for with doubler tongue

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Then thine (thou serpent) neuer Adder stung.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: You spend your passion on a mispris'd mood,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: I am not guiltie of {% italic: Lysanders %} blood:

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Nor is he dead for ought that I can tell.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I pray thee tell me then that he is well.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: And if I could, what should I get therefore?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: A priuiledge, neuer to see me more;

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And from thy hated presence part I: see me no more

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Whether he be dead or no.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: There is no following her in this fierce vaine,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Here therefore for a while I will remaine.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: So sorrowes heauinesse doth heauier grow:

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: For debt that bankrout slip doth sorrow owe,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Which now in some slight measure it will pay,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: If for his tender here I make some stay.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: What hast thou done? Thou hast mistaken quite

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: And laid the loue iuyce on some true loues sight:

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Of thy misprision, must perforce ensue

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Some true loue turn'd, and not a false turn'd true.

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: Then fate ore‑rules, that one man holding troth,

lines.speaker: Rob.
lines.text: A million faile, confounding oath on oath.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: About the wood, goe swifter then the winde,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: And {% italic: Helena %} of {% italic: Athens %} looke thou finde.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: All fancy sicke she is, and pale of cheere,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: With sighes of loue, that costs the fresh bloud deare.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: By some illusion see thou bring her heere,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Ile charme his eyes against she doth appeare.

lines.speaker: Robin.
lines.text: I go, I go, looke how I goe,

lines.speaker: Robin.
lines.text: Swifter then arrow from the {% italic: Tartars %} bowe.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Flower of this purple die,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Hit with {% italic: Cupids %} archery,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Sinke in apple of his eye,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: When his loue he doth espie,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Let her shine as gloriously

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: As the {% italic: Venus %} of the sky.

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: When thou wak'st if she be by,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Beg of her for remedy.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Captaine of our Fairy band,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: {% italic: Helena %} is heere at hand,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: And the youth, mistooke by me,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Pleading for a Louers fee.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Shall we their fond Pageant see?

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Lord, what fooles these mortals be!

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Stand aside: the noyse they make,

lines.speaker: Ob.
lines.text: Will cause {% italic: Demetrius %} to awake.

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: Then will two at once wooe one,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: That must needs be sport alone:

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: And those things doe best please me,

lines.speaker: Puck.
lines.text: That befall preposterously.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Why should you think y {% italic: t %} I should wooe in scorn?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Scorne and derision neuer comes in teares:

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Looke when I vow I weepe; and vowes so borne,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: In their natiuity all truth appeares.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: How can these things in me, seeme scorne to you?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Bearing the badge of faith to proue them true.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: You doe aduance your cunning more & more,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: When truth kils truth, O diuelish holy fray!

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: These vowes are {% italic: Hermias %}. Will you giue her ore?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Weigh oath with oath, and you will nothing weigh.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Your vowes to her, and me, (put in two scales {% italic: ) %}

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Will euen weigh, and both as light as tales.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I had no iudgement, when to her I swore.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Nor none in my minde, now you giue her ore.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %} loues her, and he loues not you.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: O Helen, goddesse, nimph, perfect, diuine,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: To what my, loue, shall I compare thine eyne!

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Christall is muddy, O how ripe in show,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Thy lips, those kissing cherries, tempting grow!

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: That pure congealed white, high {% italic: Taurus %} snow,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Fan'd with the Easterne winde, turnes to a crow,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: When thou holdst vp thy hand. O let me kisse

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: This Princesse of pure white, this seale of blisse.

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: O spight! O hell! I see you are all bent

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: To set against me, for your merriment:

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: If you were ciuill, and knew curtesie,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: You would not doe me thus much iniury.

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: Can you not hate me, as I know you doe,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: But you must ioyne in soules to mocke me to?

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: If you are men, as men you are in show,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: You would not vse a gentle Lady so;

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: To vow, and sweare, and superpraise my parts,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: When I am sure you hate me with your hearts.

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: You both are Riuals, and loue {% italic: Hermia %};

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: And now both Riuals to mocke {% italic: Helena %}.

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: A trim exploit, a manly enterprize,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: To coniure teares vp in a poore maids eyes,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: With your derision; none of noble sort,

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: Would so offend a Virgin, and extort

lines.speaker: Hell.
lines.text: A poore soules patience, all to make you sport.

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: You are vnkind {% italic: Demetrius %}; be not so,

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: For you loue {% italic: Hermia %}; this you know I know;

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: And here with all good will, with all my heart,

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: In {% italic: Hermias %} loue I yeeld you vp my part;

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: And yours of {% italic: Helena %}, to me bequeath,

lines.speaker: Lysa.
lines.text: Whom I do loue, and will do to my death.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Neuer did mockers wast more idle breth.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: {% italic: Lysander %}, keep thy {% italic: Hermia %}, I will none:

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: If ere I lou'd her, all that loue is gone.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: My heart to her, but as guest‑wise soiourn'd,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: And now to {% italic: Helen %} it is home return'd,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: There to remaine.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: It is not so.

lines.speaker: De.
lines.text: Disparage not the faith thou dost not know,

lines.speaker: De.
lines.text: Lest to thy perill thou abide it deare.

lines.speaker: De.
lines.text: Looke where thy Loue comes, yonder is thy deare.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Dark night, that from the eye his function takes,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: The eare more quicke of apprehension makes,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Wherein it doth impaire the seeing sense,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: It paies the hearing double recompence.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Thou art not by mine eye, {% italic: Lysander %} found,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Mine eare (I thanke it) brought me to that sound.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: But why vnkindly didst thou leaue me so?

lines.speaker: Lysan.
lines.text: Why should hee stay whom Loue doth presse ( to go?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: What loue could presse {% italic: Lysander %} from my side?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Lysanders %} loue (that would not let him bide)

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Faire {% italic: Helena %}; who more engilds the night,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Then all yon fierie oes, and eies of light.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Why seek'st thou me? Could not this make thee know,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: The hate I bare thee, made me leaue thee so?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: You speake not as you thinke; it cannot be.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Loe, she is one of this confederacy,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Now I perceiue they haue conioyn'd all three,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To fashion this false sport in spight of me.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Iniurous Hermia, most vngratefull maid,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Haue you conspir'd, haue you with these contriu'd

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To baite me, with this foule derision?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Is all the counsell that we two haue shar'd,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: The sisters vowes, the houres that we haue spent,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: When wee haue chid the hasty footed time,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: For parting vs; O, is all forgot?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: All schooledaies friendship, child‑hood innocence?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: We Hermia, like two Artificiall gods,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Haue with our needles, created both one flower,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Both on one sampler, sitting on one cushion,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Both warbling of one song, both in one key;

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: As if our hands, our sides, voices, and mindes

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Had beene incorporate. So we grew together,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Like to a double cherry, seeming parted,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: But yet a vnion in partition,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Two louely berries molded on one stem,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: So with two seeming bodies, but one heart,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Two of the first life coats in Heraldry,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Due but to one and crowned with one crest.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: And will you rent our ancient loue asunder,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To ioyne with men in scorning your poore friend?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: It is not friendly, 'tis not maidenly.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Our sexe as well as I, may chide you for it,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Though I alone doe feele the iniurie.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I am amazed at your passionate words,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I scorne you not; It seemes that you scorne me.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Haue you not set {% italic: Lysander %}, as in scorne

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To follow me, and praise my eies and face?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: And made your other loue, {% italic: Demetrius %}

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: (Who euen but now did spurne me with his foote)

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To call me goddesse, nimph, diuine, and rare,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Precious, celestiall? Wherefore speakes he this

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: To her he hates? And wherefore doth {% italic: Lysander %}

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Denie your loue (so rich within his soule)

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: And tender me (forsooth {% italic: ) %} affection,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: But by your setting on, by your consent?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: What though I be not so in grace as you,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: So hung vpon with loue, so fortunate?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: (But miserable most, to loue vnlou'd)

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: This you should pittie, rather then despise.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I vnderstand not what you meane by this.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: I, doe, perseuer, counterfeit sad lookes,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Make mouthes vpon me when I turne my backe,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Winke each at other, hold the sweete iest vp:

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: This sport well carried, shall be chronicled.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: If you haue any pittie, grace, or manners,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: You would not make me such an argument:

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: But fare ye well, 'tis partly mine owne fault,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Which death or absence soone shall remedie.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Stay gentle {% italic: Helena %}, heare my excuse,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: My loue, my life, my soule, faire {% italic: Helena %}.

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: O excellent!

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Sweete, do not scorne her so.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: If she cannot entreate, I can compell.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Thou canst compell, no more then she entreate.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Thy threats haue no more strength then her weak praise.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Helen %}, I loue thee, by my life I doe;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I sweare by that which I will lose for thee,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: To proue him false, that saies I loue thee not.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: I say, I loue thee more then he can do.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: If thou say so, with‑draw and proue it too.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Quick, come.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: {% italic: Lysander %}, whereto tends all this?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Away, you {% italic: Ethiope %}.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: No, no, Sir, seeme to breake loose;

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: Take on as you would follow,

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: But yet come not: you are a tame man, go.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Hang off thou cat, thou bur; vile thing let loose,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Or I will shake thee from me like a serpent.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Why are you growne so rude?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: What change is this sweete Loue?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Thy loue? out tawny {% italic: Tartar %}, out;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Out loathed medicine; O hated poison hence.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Do you not iest?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Yes sooth, and so do you.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: {% italic: Demetrius %}: I will keepe my word with thee.

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: I would I had your bond: for I perceiue

lines.speaker: Dem.
lines.text: A weake bond holds you; Ile not trust your word.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: What, should I hurt her, strike her, kill her dead?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Although I hate her, Ile not harme her so.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: What, can you do me greater harme then hate?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Hate me, wherefore? O me, what newes my Loue?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Am not I {% italic: Hermia %}? Are not you {% italic: Lysander? %}

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: I am as faire now, as I was ere while.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Since night you lou'd me: yet since night you left me.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Why then you left me (O the gods forbid

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: In earnest, shall I say?

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: I, by my life;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: And neuer did desire to see thee more.

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Therefore be out of hope, of question, of doubt;

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: Be certaine, nothing truer: 'tis no iest,

lines.speaker: Lys.
lines.text: That I doe hate thee, and loue {% italic: Helena %}.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: O me, you iugler, you canker blossome,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: You theefe of loue; What, haue you come by night,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And stolne my loues heart from him?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Fine yfaith:

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Haue you no modesty, no maiden shame,

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: No touch of bashfulnesse? What, will you teare

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Impatient answers from my gentle tongue?

lines.speaker: Hel.
lines.text: Fie, fie, you counterfeit, you puppet, you.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Puppet? why so? I, that way goes the game.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Now I perceiue that she hath made compare

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Betweene our statures, she hath vrg'd her height,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And with her personage, her tall personage,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Her height (forsooth) she hath preuail'd with him.

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: And are you growne so high in his esteeme,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: Because I am so dwarfish, and so low?

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: How low am I, thou painted May‑pole? Speake,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: How low am I? I am not yet so low,

lines.speaker: Her.
lines.text: But that my nailes can reach vnto thine eyes.
